term_description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study
Given first name
Given last name.
Valid email address
The sorting or visualisation technology used.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.
The type of tissue sampled for the study.
The date when the sample was collected with year, month and day specified in the format, YYYY-MM-DD.

The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places.
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence.
The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in metres.
The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in metres.
A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling dwc:Event.

The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.
A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study
A descriptive name of the protocol used for single-cell sequencing.
A free-text description of the process used to separate cells from tissues or cell aggregates.
term_example: Tissue was enzymatically dissociated using collagenase for 30 minutes.

term_description: A free-text description of the markers used to enrich specific cell types during single-cell isolation.
The kit used to isolate the cells.
Reference to literature sources that describe the protocol or methods used.
term_example: Doe et al. (2024), 'Single-cell RNA-seq: A comprehensive overview'

term_description: Reference link to protocols.io for additional details on the protocol.
Reference to the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) in workflow hub.
The method used to dissociate tissues into single cells.
Metrics used to assess the quality of single cells before sequencing.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the cell suspension for the sample in the study.
A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study
A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the sample
The type of suspension used to keep cells in solution during processing.
An number representing the number of cells in the sequencing library.
The percentage of living cells in a sample, indicating the health and quality of cells for RNA-sequencing analysis.
The method used to evaluate the viability of cells in the sample, often involving staining or flow cytometry techniques.
The size of the cell, typically measured in micrometres.
The volume of the cell suspension in microlitres.
The concentration of cells in the suspension.
The dilution factor of the cell suspension.
The volume of the cell suspension loaded into the single-cell RNA-sequencing system for analysis.

A solution used to dilute cell suspensions to a desired concentration, typically prior to loading cells into a device for single-cell RNA sequencing. It helps maintain cell viability and integrity during processing.
term_example: PBS (Phosphate-buffered saline) with 0.04% BSA (Bovine serum albumin)

term_description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the library preparation.
The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.
The average length of RNA fragments in base pairs (BP) after library preparation, indicating the quality and suitability of the RNA for sequencing.
The end from which the molecule was sequenced.
Barcode sequence used on the i5 adapter during library preparation for identifying samples in multiplexed single-cell RNA-sequencing.
Barcode sequence used on the i7 adapter to distinguish samples in multiplexed sequencing runs.
Specifies if both i5 and i7 indices (dual) or only one index (single) was used for sample identification during sequencing.
The length (in base pairs) of the index sequences used (i5 and/or i7).
The nucleotide sequence of the i5 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.
The specific nucleotide sequence of the i7 index used for a sample.
Identifier for the 96-well plate used in sample preparation.
The row identifier in a 96-well plate indicating the sample's position.
The column identifier in a 96-well plate indicating the sample's position.
The cell marker for the Fluorescence-Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) of cells.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.
This refers to the machine or platform used for sequencing, with variations in throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.
The type of library layout used for sequencing.
The ideal number of sequencing reads to be generated per cell.
The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.

The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.
E.g. "0".
The type of read that contains the UMI barcode.
The actual nucleotide sequence obtained from Complementary DNA (cDNA) during sequencing.
The starting position of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read within the entire sequence, indicating where the read begins after any barcodes or technical sequences.
The size of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
The name of the file that contains read 1.
The name of the file that contains read 2.
The name of the file that contains index 1.
The name of the file that contains index 2.

Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the read 1 file and the read 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the index 1 file and the index 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

A file containing the known cell barcodes in the
dataset.
Indicate version and include stable link to genome data (or attach genome fasta file).
Quantification using whole gene intervals or exons.
seqspec format
Reads/UMI
Statistics of the Reads or Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI).
Depending on number of cells recovered (not targeted) and technology
Show Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMIs) per barcode distribution and threshold applied
Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) threshold used to discriminate cells from non-cells. Description of algorithm (if any) and parameters used to determine cells or non-cells.
Cells/nuclei discarded based on % mitochondrial reads, % rRNA reads, etc.
Report % UMIs in background cell barcodes, and algorithm (if any) used to remove ambient RNA
term_example: Ambient RNA removed if >5% UMIs in background barcodes

term_description: Depending on number of cells recovered (not targeted) and technology
